title: Developer Portfolio
subheader: Personal Showcase of Projects and Skills
description: A developer portfolio showcasing my projects and skills. Built with React, Vite, TypeScript, Material-UI, and Tailwind CSS. Designed to present my work in an organized and visually appealing manner.
contributions: Developed the entire frontend of the portfolio using React and TypeScript.
Designed the portfolio using Material-UI and Tailwind CSS to create a visually appealing and user-friendly interface.
Implemented a responsive design to ensure the portfolio looks good on all devices.
problemSolving: Created a dynamic project display system that allows me to easily add, remove, or update projects.
Used Material-UI and Tailwind CSS to create a visually appealing and user-friendly interface.
shortDescription: A website to showcase my expertise as a developer and designer.

title: HySCAN
subheader: Hydrogen Safety Codes & Standards Applicability Navigator
description: As one of the developers, I contributed to HySCAN, a web application with intuitive, accessible workflows, designed to support users in navigating hydrogen (H2) codes and standards. It is a part of the H2Tools Suite, which is a group of tools developed and maintained by Pacific Northwest National Laboratory. It efficiently identified and categorized areas of adherence, empowering users with tailored solutions for enhanced safety and efficiency.
shareholderDescription: HySCAN was jointly developed by Sandia National Laboratories (Sandia), National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL), and Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) and operated and maintained by PNNL, with funding from the U.S. Department of Energy's Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy (EERE) under the Hydrogen and Fuel Cell Technologies Office (HFTO).
contributions: Created and maintained React components for the application using styled-components.
**Key to the creation of algorithms** to understand the user's system, identify applicable codes and standards, and group related questions.
Implemented bug fixes and design changes to improve the user experience after demos and sponsor feedback.
Developed a dynamic question system where each component has corresponding questions, with additional questions based on conditional responses.
problemSolving: Developed a solution to dynamically generate questions based on the user's system and the codes and standards applicable to it.
Designed a system to categorize and group questions based on the codes and standards they relate to.
**Implemented responsive design principles** for optimal viewing across devices.
Created a mechanism to relay optional references to related documents based on the user's answers.
shortDescription: An application to support those who utilize hydrogen (H2) in identifying hydrogen-specific codes and standard documents that are relevant to their systems.

images.description: The home page for the HySCAN application
The disclaimer developed for HySCAN; I created this design.
HySCAN Component Selection List: the first step in the workflow of the application, where users select the components of their hydrogen system.
A list of the components that the user previously selected.
HySCAN Component Card List: the second step in the workflow of the application, where answer questions about their system, including specifics about the components selected in the previous step.

images.alt: HySCAN Results Page: suggested codes and standards
images.description: HySCAN Results Page: the final step in the workflow of the application, where users are presented with the codes and standards that are applicable to their system based on their responses.
An example of how related questions were grouped together, where multiple elements of the components in the system can all relate to the same code or standard.

title: Explainable AI: Exposing the Black Box
description: As part of a larger venture, this work focused on Explainable AI (XAI) to help stakeholders understand complex AI models. The project explored different XAI methods and implemented SHAP (Shapley Additive exPlanations), a Python package for XAI. The designs I created were seen as viable by the stakeholders, which was **instrumental in securing an additional $50k in funding** for this and other parts of the project.
shareholderDescription: This research was part of a larger, multi-lab venture, supported by the National Nuclear Security Administration, Office of Defense Nuclear Nonproliferation Research And Development.
contributions: Designed an intuitive interface to visualize the data output from the AI models, aiding in the understanding of complex AI models.
problemSolving: Developed a user-friendly interface to present the results of black box AI models using SHAP.
Designed a system to generate both local and global explanations, making the AI models more understandable for stakeholders.
shortDescription: A research project to understand and interpret black box AI models using Explainable AI methods, one part of a larger venture. My primary role was designing the interface to visualize the AI model outputs.

images.description: The home page for the designs I created, which contains a plot indicating the impact of the over 200 features in the dataset.

images.alt: Explainable AI Interface: feature detail page
images.description: A detailed view of the SHAP values for a specific feature in the dataset.

images.alt: Explainable AI Interface: sample detail page
images.description: This page delves into more detail on one sample (data) in the dataset, showing the SHAP values for each feature in the dataset for that sample.

images.alt: Explainable AI Interface: feature impact bar graph
images.description: Moving on to a new kind of plot, here we have a bar graph showing the impact of each feature on the model's prediction for a specific sample.

images.alt: Explainable AI Interface: raw SHAP values
images.description: The raw SHAP values for all samples and all features in the dataset.
This advanced plot is used by model developers to compare features and see how they impacted each other.
